page.title: 05Motorway Services,Watford
page.content: The M1 motorway passes between the villages of Watford and Ashby St.Ledgers.In 1959 the Blue Boar Service Station was opened.Now it serves about 4,000 people daily.It never closes and gives a 24-hour service 7 days a week.The staff work shifts. It is always busy as it serves an important transport route,but the busiest times are between noon and 6.30pm,and the busiest days are at weekends. The most popular foods are quick snacks.Some foods are delivered by lorry from a bakery,others are made at the station itself. Facilities include shops,petrol stations with 18 pumps,toilets,babies changing room,telephones,post boxes,and a lorry drivers' cafe,as well as the cafeteria.
